enabled.description: Indicates whether the alert is active.

percent.description: Specifies the percentage threshold for the alert.

low_remaining_transaction_limit.description:
Configures an alert for when the remaining spending limit dips below a specified percentage. When enabled, a webhook notification will be triggered if the remaining limit falls below the defined threshold. Note that:

- Only one notification per spend limit interval will be sent. A webhook is triggered only when the threshold is crossed, and further spending below the threshold will not trigger additional notifications. Example: if the percent enabled is 10, a webhook will be sent once the remaining limit is at or less than 10%.
- If the spend limit has been updated, a new notification will be sent when the new threshold is crossed.
- This alert only applies to multiple use cards.
- If not specified, this setting will be enabled by default with ``enabled`` set to ``true`` and ``percent`` set to an account specific default value.

active_from.description: If provided, authorizations prior to this time will be rejected.

active_to.description: If provided, authorizations after this time will be rejected.

allowed_currencies.description: Allowed Currencies for transactions. Please note if this field is absent from request payload, or has a value of `null` or empty array `[]`, then all transaction currencies will be allowed.

allowed_merchant_categories.description: Allowed Merchant Category Codes. Please note if this field is absent from request payload, or has a value of `null` or empty array `[]`, then all merchant categories will be allowed.

allowed_transaction_count.description: Specifies whether this card is a Single or Multiple Use card. Possible values are `SINGLE`, `MULTIPLE`. Single Use means that the card can only be used for 1 successful debit transaction.

blocked_transaction_usages.description:
List of disabled transaction usages, based on transaction_scope and usage_scope values. Please note if this field is absent from request payload or has a value of `null`, then all transaction usages will be allowed unless a default configration is added.

You can add multiple transaction_scope and usage_scope values. The most restrictive scope(s) would apply.

transaction_limits.description: Transaction limits for the card. Multiple transaction limits can be configured based on single currency. Each transaction will be checked against the limits with interval after currency conversion rate applied

active_from.description: If not provided, current value will be maintained. If provided, authorizations prior to this time will be rejected.

active_to.description: If not provided, current value will be maintained. If provided, authorizations after this time will be rejected.

allowed_merchant_categories.description: Allowed Merchant Category Codes. Please note if this field is absent from request payload, or has a value of `null` or empty array `[]`, then all merchant categories will be allowed. Default value is `[]`.

blocked_transaction_usages.description: List of disabled transaction usages, based on transaction_scope and usage_scope values. You can add multiple transaction_scope and usage_scope values. The most restrictive scope(s) would apply.

transaction_limits.description: Transaction limits for the card. Multiple transaction limits can be configured based on single currency. Each transaction will be checked against the limits with interval after currency conversion rate applied

expiry_date.description: The authorization will expire after this date if not posted

failure_reason.description: The reason why this authorization failed (if status is FAILED). Can be one of: `ACCOUNT_INVALID`, `CARD_CLOSED`, `CARD_INACTIVE`, `CARD_INVALID`, `CARD_LOST_STOLEN`, `CARD_NOT_ACTIVATED`, `CARD_REISSUED_TO_NEW_NUMBER`, `CARDHOLDER_VERIFICATION_FAILED`, `CURRENCY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `CVV_INVALID`, `EXPIRY_MISSING`, `INSUFFICIENT_AVAILABLE_CREDIT`,  `INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS`, `INTERNAL_ERROR`, `INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE`, `LIMIT_EXCEEDED`, `MERCHANT_CATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `NOT_SUPPORTED`,  `OUT_OF_ALLOWED_TIME_RANGE`, `PIN_INVALID`, `PIN_RETRIES_EXCEEDED`, `REMOTE_AUTH_DECLINED`, `RESTRICTED_COUNTRY`, `SUSPECTED_FRAUD`, `TRANSACTION_BLOCKED`, `TRANSACTION_BLOCKED_AT_TERMINAL`, `TRANSACTION_USAGE_DISABLED`, `MERCHANT_COUNTRY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_CATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_SUBCATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`. Learn more about [transaction failure reasons](/docs/issuing__transaction-failure-reasons).

fee_details.description: List of fee details associated with the authorization

lifecycle_id.description: A identifier that links multiple related transactions belonging to the same card payment—such as authorizations, reversals, captures, and refunds—under a single transaction lifecycle. Note: this field will be null for transactions created before January 2025

network_transaction_id.description: The transaction ID from VISA network

retrieval_ref.description: Transaction retrieval reference number. Data element 37 of a financial transaction message (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8583)

risk_details.description: Risk details provides a comprehensive overview of the risk evaluation for a card transaction, including identified risk factors, actions taken by the risk engine, and the outcome of the 3D Secure authentication process. It encapsulates key elements that assess the potential threat level, safeguard the transaction, and ensure the cardholder’s identity is verified. N.b. this information will only be available for transactions on or after 1st Sept 2024.

status.description: The status of this authorization. Can be one of `CLEARED`, `EXPIRED`, `FAILED`, `PENDING`, `REVERSED`

updated_by_transaction.description: Id of the transaction which updated status of this transaction. eg: capture

page_after.description: A marker for retrieving the next page of results. Include this value in the `page` request parameter to retrieve subsequent pages.

page_before.description: A marker for retrieving the previous page of results. Include this value in the `page` request parameter to retrieve previous pages.

page_after.description: A marker for retrieving the next page of results. Include this value in the `page` request parameter to retrieve subsequent pages.

page_before.description: A marker for retrieving the previous page of results. Include this value in the `page` request parameter to retrieve previous pages.

page_before.description: A marker for retrieving the previous page of results. Include this value in the `page` request parameter to retrieve previous pages.

country_code.description: Country code. (2-letter ISO 3166-2 country code)

number.description: Local business registration number i.e. an official signal of identification for the business.

type.description: Type of business registration number, depending on what's applicable to the country the business is registered in.

activate_on_issue.description: Set this to `true` to activate the physical card when it is created. This will enable use of the card while it’s being delivered to the cardholder. Virtual cards will always be activated upon creation.

authorization_controls.description: Spend controls that determine the rules and restrictions to check for transaction authorizations.

card_status.description: Current card status. See [Card Status](/docs/issuing__create-cards__card-statuses) for definitions.

client_data.description: Client data which will be stored against the card record in Airwallex.

issue_to.description: Who the card is issued to - client or individual. A value of `ORGANISATION` indicates that the card will be issued to the client themselves i.e. Purchasing Card

name_on_card.description: Name to be printed on card.

nick_name.description: A nick name for the card

note.description: Notes that are to be stored against the card request (for client reference)

postal_address.description: Optional postal address of physical card delivery.

primary_contact_details.description: Details of the primary contact of the card

purpose.description: The purpose of the card's usage. Only available for expense cards.

request_id.description: A unique request ID specified by the client. Requests with the same request_id will be ignored. This allows requests to be replayed if client is unsure of the outcome, e.g. due to network issues, system failures, etc.  Note: Can be non-UUID as long as it is unique between requests

type.description: Card type - `PREPAID`, `DEBIT`, `GOOD_FUNDS_CREDIT` or `DD_OTA`. `DD_OTA` is Deferred Debit card available for OTA (Online Travel Agent) customers only in UK/Europe countries. If card type is not set, the default card type which is a part of your account setting will be used.

all_card_versions.description: Contains information about all versions of a card. A version changes with change in PAN

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the Card. You can specify up to 20 keys, with key names up to 20 characters long and values up to 150 characters long.

delivery_details.description: Delivery detail of the card. Only available for physical cards.

interchange_percent.description: Interchange percent of the card - This is only available for `sub_type="B2B_TRAVEL"` cards. Interchange can vary from 0.8 to 1.9, with increments of 0.1.

purpose.description:
`COMMERCIAL`: A card used for business purposes backed by funding belonging to a business.
`CONSUMER`: A card used for personal purposes backed by funding belonging to an individual.

sub_type.description: Sub type of the program - This is used for specific products under the defined program types. e.g `B2B_TRAVEL` which designates BINs for travel use cases (E.g OTAs).

type.description: Card type - `PREPAID`, `DEBIT`, `CREDIT` or `DEFERRED_DEBIT`. `DEFERRED_DEBIT` is Deferred Debit card available for OTA (Online Travel Agent) customers only in UK/Europe countries. If card type is not set, the default card type which is a part of your account setting will be used.

interchange_percent.description: Interchange percent of the card - This is only available for `sub_type="B2B_TRAVEL"` cards. Interchange can vary from 0.8 to 1.9, with increments of 0.1.

purpose.description:
`COMMERCIAL`: A card used for business purposes backed by funding belonging to a business.
`CONSUMER`: A card used for personal purposes backed by funding belonging to an individual.

sub_type.description: Sub type of the program - This is used for specific products under the defined program types. e.g `B2B_TRAVEL` which designates BINs for travel use cases (E.g OTAs).

type.description: Card type - `PREPAID`, `DEBIT`, `CREDIT` or `DEFERRED_DEBIT`. `DEFERRED_DEBIT` is Deferred Debit card available for OTA (Online Travel Agent) customers only in UK/Europe countries. If card type is not set, the default card type which is a part of your account setting will be used.

cardholder_id.description: Unique Identifier for cardholder, if this is an employee card.

created_at.description: Date card was created

authorization_controls.description: Spend controls that determine the rules and restrictions to check for transaction authorizations.

nick_name.description: A nick name for the card

purpose.description: Optional purpose for card's usage when card `issueTo` value is `ORGANISATION`. Can be one of - `BUSINESS_EXPENSES`, `CLIENT_EXPENSES`, `MARKETING_EXPENSES`, `OFFICE_SUPPLIES`, `ONLINE_PURCHASING`, `OTHER`, `SUBSCRIPTIONS`, `TEAM_EXPENSES`, `TRAVEL_EXPENSES`. Default value is `BUSINESS_EXPENSES`.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the Card. You can specify up to 20 keys, with key names up to 20 characters long and values up to 150 characters long.

card_number.description: Masked card number of this version

card_status.description: Card status of this version. See [Card Status](/docs/issuing__create-cards__card-statuses) for definitions.

card_version.description: Version Id which uniquely identifies this card version object

created_at.description: Creation time of the card version.

first_name.description: First name of cardholder.

last_name.description: Last name for cardholder.

first_name.description: First name of cardholder.

last_name.description: Last name for cardholder.

mobile_number.description: The mobile number of the cardholder.

status.description:
The status of the cardholder. One of `PENDING`, `READY`, `DISABLED` or `INCOMPLETE`, which are defined as follows:
`PENDING`: Cardholder is currently in review.
`READY`: Cardholder is ready to be issued cards.
`INCOMPLETE`: Cardholder record has incomplete information or more data is required to move them to `READY`.

amount.description: The amount to be disputed. If not specified, the dispute will take the billing amount as the dispute amount. If specified, the specified amount is used as the dispute amount for partial dispute. The specified amount cannot be larger than the billing amount. Note: The dispute currency is always in the billing currency of the transaction.

evidence_files.description: A list of file id that contains the evidence for the dispute. The file id can be retrieved after uploading the supporting document via [POST Upload a file](https://www.airwallex.com/docs/api#/Supporting_Services/File_Service/_api_v1_files_upload/post).

notes.description: The explanation on why the cardholder is disputing the transaction can be provided here.

reason.description: The reason for raising the dispute. It can be one of: `SUSPECTED_FRAUD`, `UNAUTHORIZED_TRANSACTION`, `DUPLICATED_TRANSACTION`, `PAID_BY_OTHER_MEANS`, `GOODS_SERVICE_NOT_AS_DESCRIBED`, `GOODS_DAMAGED`, `GOODS_SERVICE_NOT_RECEVIED`, `REFUND_UNPROCESSED`, `GOODS_SERVICE_CANCELED`, `RECURRING_CANCELED`, `OTHER`. Learn more about the [dispute reasons](https://www.airwallex.com/docs/issuing__handle-transaction-disputes#dispute-reasons).

reference.description: A value can be added for your internal reference. Maximum 20 characters.

transaction_id.description: The unique identifier for the transaction to be disputed.

deleted.description: Will be set to true if the cardholder was deleted successfully.

delivery_mode.description:
`MAIL`: Delivery of the card is delivered via mail shipment. Tracking may or may not be provided.
`EXPRESS`: Delivery of the card is tracked and delivered via express shipment. A tracking_link will always be provided.

mobile_number.description: The mobile number for the card delivery.

preferred_delivery_mode.description: The delivery mode customer selected when the Create Card API is called.

status.description: See [Delivery Status](/docs/issuing__retrieve-physical-card-delivery-details) for definitions.

status_description.description: A brief description of the status

tracked.description: Specifies if the delivery of the card is tracked. If `true`, a tracking link will be provided when status becomes `DISPATCHED`

tracking_number.description: Delivery tracking number of this card.

updated_at.description: Last update time of the delivery details

mobile_number.description: Optional mobile number for physical card delivery in E.164 format (e.g., +6512345678). Defaults to the cardholder's registered number if not provided. Required for EXPRESS delivery or when the destination country is China.

preferred_delivery_mode.description: Customizable options that customers can specify for physical card delivery. The requested delivery mode will be provided on a best-effort basis. `MAIL`: Delivery of the card is delivered via mail shipment. `EXPRESS`: Delivery of the card is tracked and delivered via express shipment.

device_id.description: The identifier for the device associated with the token

device_type.description:
Type of device associated with the token
One of `MOBILE_PHONE`, `TABLET`, `WATCH`, `MOBILEPHONE_OR_TABLET`, `PC`

card_id.description: Unique identifier for card associated with the token

cardholder_id.description: Unique identifier for cardholder associated with the token

create_time.description: The time this token was created

device_information.description: Additional information related to the device associated with the token

pan_reference_id.description: Unique identifier for the tokenization of this card. Used by mobile SDKs to determine whether this card has already been provisioned to the device.

risk_information.description: General risk information about the token

token_reference_id.description: Unique identifier of the digital wallet token within the card network

token_status.description:
Status of the token
One of `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `SUSPENDED`, `DEACTIVATED`

token_type.description:
The type of this token
One of `SECURE_ELEMENT`, `HCE`, `CARD_ON_FILE`, `ECOMMERCE`, `QRC`

evidence_files.description: The list of file id containing the evidence added to the dispute during the dispute process.

note.description: The note added to the dispute.

updated_at.description: Time when the dispute was updated.

updated_by.description: The party who updated the dispute. It can be one of: `CUSTOMER`, `AIRWALLEX`.

business_identifiers.description: Local business registration number i.e. an official signal of identification for the business.

amount.description: Fee amount

currency.description: Fee currency code

type.description: Fee type

buy_currency.description: Currency (3-letter ISO-4217 code) that is bought.

rate.description: The effective rate of fx after markup.

sell_currency.description: Currency (3-letter ISO-4217 code) that is sold.

country.description: ISO country code of identification document.

document_back_file_id.description: The ID for an image of the back of the given document. This can be retrieved by uploading a file to the file upload endpoint within the API.

document_front_file_id.description: The ID for an image of the front of the given document. This can be retrieved by uploading a file to the file upload endpoint within the API.

expiry_date.description: Expiry date of the identification document provided, in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

gender.description: Gender as specified on UK drivers license. Not required for other identification types.

number.description: Document number. May be a license number or passport number.

state.description: State the document was issued in. Required only if type is DRIVERS_LICENSE and country is AU.

type.description: Type of identification being provided. May be PASSPORT, DRIVERS_LICENSE, or ID_CARD.

date_of_birth.description: The individual's date of birth, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

name.description: The full name of the Individual. Only characters in English are supported.

remote_auth.description: Remote authorization config. Please read the [remote auth product documentation](/docs/issuing__remote-authorization) for more information. You will need to reach out to our support team to enable this feature for you.

remote_call_config.description: Remote call config. You will need to reach out to our support team to enable this feature for you.

remote_provisioning_config.description: Remote provisioning config. You will need to reach out to our support team to enable this feature for you.

blocked_transaction_usages.description: Transaction usage settings. The default controls are set based on regulatory requirements and can only be reviewed by reaching out to an Account Services team member.

remote_auth_settings.description: Remote authorization config. Please read the [remote auth product documentation](/docs/issuing__remote-authorization) for more information. You will need to reach out to our support team to enable this feature for you.

remote_call_config.description: Remote call config. You will need to reach out to our support team to enable this feature for you.

remote_provisioning_config.description: Digital wallet remote provisioning config. You will need to reach out to our support team to enable this feature for you.

spending_limit_settings.description: Spending limit settings. The default and maximum limits can be modified by reaching out to an Account Services team member.

total_authorized.description: Total amount authorized in the specified billing currency.

total_credited.description: Total amount credited to the account in the specified billing currency.

total_debited.description: Total amount debited from the account in the specified billing currency.

total_declined.description: Total amount declined in the specified billing currency.

total_expired.description: Total amount expired in the specified billing currency.

total_pending.description: Total amount pending authorization in the specified billing currency.

total_reversed.description: Total amount reversed in the specified billing currency.

billing_amounts.description: An overview of billing amounts for the lifecycle.

billing_currency.description: Currency used for billing (ISO currency code).

card_id.description: Unique identifier of the card involved in the transaction.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the lifecycle was created (ISO 8601 format).

digital_wallet_token.description: Details of the digital wallet token if one was used.

merchant.description: Merchant of the first event in the lifecycle.

status.description: Current status of the lifecycle. Can be one of: AUTHORIZED, CLEARED, DECLINED, EXPIRED, REFUNDED, REVERSED, VERIFIED

updated_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the lifecycle was last updated (ISO 8601 format).

conversion_details.description: Details of the fx conversion if one was used.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the lifecycle event was created (ISO 8601 format).

digital_wallet_token.description: Details of the digital wallet token if one was used.

expiry_date.description: The lifecycle event will expire after this date if not posted. Only available for AUTHORIZATION events.

failure_reason.description: The reason why this transaction failed (if status is FAILED). Can be one of: `ACCOUNT_INVALID`, `CARD_CLOSED`, `CARD_INACTIVE`, `CARD_INVALID`, `CARD_LOST_STOLEN`, `CARD_NOT_ACTIVATED`, `CARDHOLDER_VERIFICATION_FAILED`, `CURRENCY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `CVV_INVALID`, `EXPIRY_MISSING`, `INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS`, `INTERNAL_ERROR`, `INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE`, `LIMIT_EXCEEDED`, `MERCHANT_CATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `NOT_SUPPORTED`, `PIN_INVALID`, `PIN_RETRIES_EXCEEDED`, `REMOTE_AUTH_DECLINED`, `RESTRICTED_COUNTRY`, `SUSPECTED_FRAUD`, `TRANSACTION_BLOCKED`, `TRANSACTION_BLOCKED_AT_TERMINAL`, `CARD_REISSUED_TO_NEW_NUMBER`, `TRANSACTION_USAGE_DISABLED`, `MERCHANT_COUNTRY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_CATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_SUBCATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`. Learn more about [transaction failure reasons](/docs/issuing__transaction-failure-reasons).

fee_details.description: List of fee details associated with the lifecycle event

id.description: Unique identifier for the lifecycle event.

network_transaction_id.description: The transaction ID from VISA network

retrieval_ref.description: Transaction retrieval reference number. Data element 37 of an financial transaction message (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8583)

risk_details.description: Risk details provides a comprehensive overview of the risk evaluation for a card transaction, including identified risk factors, actions taken by the risk engine, and the outcome of the 3D Secure authentication process. It encapsulates key elements that assess the potential threat level, safeguard the transaction, and ensure the cardholder’s identity is verified. N.b. this information will only be available for transactions on or after 1st Sept 2024.

transaction_type.description: Transaction type. Can be one of `PURCHASE`, `CASH_DISBURSEMENT`, `DEBIT_ADJUSTMENT`, `ACCOUNT_FUNDING_TRANSACTION`, `QUASI_CASH`, `FEE_COLLECTION`, `MERCHANT_CREDIT`, `DISPUTE_CREDIT`, `CREDIT_ADJUSTMENT`, `ORIGINAL_CREDIT`, `FUNDS_DISBURSEMENT_CREDIT`, `AVAILABLE_FUNDS_INQUIRY`, `ELIGIBILITY_INQUIRY`, `CARDHOLDER_ACCOUNT_TRANSFER_ATM`, `PAY_OTHER_PARTY`, `PAYMENT_US` or `UNKNOWN`

type.description:
Type of event: 
* AUTHORIZATION: Reserves funds, increasing the total_authorized amount
* REVERSAL: Reverses a transaction, increasing the total_reversed or total_expired amount.
* CLEARING: Finalizes a transaction, increasing the total_credited or total_debited amount.

updated_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the lifecycle event was last updated (ISO 8601 format).

id.description: Unique identifier for the merchant brand.

logo_url.description: URL of the merchant brand logo image.

name.description: Current name of the merchant brand. Please note, this is subject to change at any time, please do not rely on it for business logic.

country.description: Merchant country. Note: this field might prefixed with state name for some countries, e.g. TXUSA, you should parse the last 3 characters for country code.

postcode.description: Merchant postcode (only for merchants within the US, Canada or Brazil)

state.description: Merchant state (only for merchants within the US, Canada or Brazil)

name.description: Name of the method being configured

path.description: Path that will be combined with url for remote calls

activate_on_issue.description: Set this to `true` to activate the physical card when it is created. This will enable use of the card while it’s being delivered to the cardholder. Virtual cards will always be activated upon creation.

authorization_controls.description: Spend controls that determine the rules and restrictions to check for transaction authorizations.

client_data.description: Client data which will be stored against the card record in Airwallex.

created_by.description: Full legal name of user requesting new card

issue_to.description: Who the card is issued to - client or individual. A value of `ORGANISATION` indicates that the card will be issued to the client themselves i.e. Purchasing Card

nick_name.description: A nick name for the card

note.description: Notes that are to be stored against the card request (for client reference)

postal_address.description: Optional postal address of physical card delivery. The card will be issued to the cardholder's postal address if this value is not set. The cardholder's address will be used instead if cardholder's postal address does not exist.

primary_contact_details.description: Details of the primary contact of the new card.

purpose.description: Optional purpose for card's usage when card `issueTo` is `ORGANISATION`. Can be one of - `BUSINESS_EXPENSES`, `CLIENT_EXPENSES`, `MARKETING_EXPENSES`, `OFFICE_SUPPLIES`, `ONLINE_PURCHASING`, `OTHER`, `SUBSCRIPTIONS`, `TEAM_EXPENSES`, `TRAVEL_EXPENSES`. Default value is `BUSINESS_EXPENSES`.

request_id.description: A unique request ID specified by the client.  Requests with the same request_id will be ignored.  This allows requests to be replayed if client is unsure of the outcome, e.g. due to network issues, system failures, etc.  Note: Can be non-UUID as long as it is unique between requests

type.description: Card type - `PREPAID`, `DEBIT`, `GOOD_FUNDS_CREDIT` or `DD_OTA`. `DD_OTA` is Deferred Debit card available for OTA (Online Travel Agent) customers only in UK/Europe countries. If card type is not set, the default card type which is a part of your account setting will be used.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the Card. You can specify up to 20 keys, with key names up to 20 characters long and values up to 150 characters long.

name_on_card.description: Name to be printed on card. Must be an alphanumeric string of 26 characters or less. Note that this field will soon be deprecated.

cardholder_agreement_terms_consent_obtai.description: For Canada entities only - By setting this field to yes you confirm that you have the express consent of this.

date_of_birth.description: The individual's date of birth, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

express_consent_obtained.description: By setting this field to `yes` you confirm that you have the express consent of this cardholder for Airwallex to perform name and sanction screening or any further identity verification if required.

identification.description: The form of identification used to verify the individual's identity. This object is optional and is only required if name screening fails.

name.description: The full name of the Individual. Only characters in English are supported.

nationality.description: The 2-letter ISO country code for the individual's nationality.

paperless_notification_consent_obtained.description: For Canada entities only - By setting this field to yes you confirm that you consent to paperless notifications. You agree to the Electronic Communications Consent Agreement which states that we may provide you with all disclosures, notices and other communications, about Airwallex's services including this Agreement and any further amendments, in electronic form.

privacy_policy_terms_consent_obtained.description: For Canada entities only - By setting this field to yes you confirm that you consent to the terms of the Privacy Policy.

postal_address.description: Optional postal address of the cardholder. Only required if different to address and physical cards are to be issued.

full_name.description: Full name of the primary contact of the new card.

mobile_number.description: The mobile number of the primary contact of the new card.

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of the primary contact of the new card in format YEAR-MONTH-DAY.

page_after.description: A pointer to the start of the page list used in pagination to retrieve the next page of results

page_before.description: A pointer to the end of the page list used in pagination to retrieve the previous page of results

amount.description: Transaction limit amount.

remaining.description: Remaining amount of transaction limit for that interval. Refunds are always restored to active limits (each refund will increase the limit balance). Please check product doc for more details.

cash_withdrawal_limits.description: Remaining Cash Withdrawal Limits for Intervals.

currency.description: Currency of transaction limits (3-letter ISO-4217 code).

created_at.description: Remote auth config creation time

default_action.description: Default action when remote auth failed

enabled.description: Remote auth config enabled flag, Airwallex will start sending remote auth request to your endpoint once this flag is enabled.

shared_secret.description: Shared secret to verify our remote auth request. Please note this field only return once when you init remote auth config or request a new secret in the update request, get issuing setting always return null.

updated_at.description: Remote auth config last update time

url.description: The url for your remote auth endpoint, we will send remote auth request to this endpoint when your config is enabled

default_action.description: Default action when remote auth failed - `AUTHORIZED` or `DECLINED`

new_shared_secret.description: Should create a new shared secret for remote auth

url.description: The url for your remote auth endpoint, this is a mandatory field when you init your remote auth config

shared_secret.description: Shared secret to verify remote call requests. Please note this field only return once when you init remote call config or request a new secret in the update request, get issuing setting always return null.

url.description: The base url for remote calls, which will be combined with the path supplied for individual methods

default_action.description: Default action when remote provisioning attempt fails

enabled.description: Remote Provisioning config enabled flag, Airwallex will start sending remote provisioning requests to your endpoint once this flag is enabled.

risk_actions_performed.description: Risk actions performed for a card transaction, triggered by rules in our risk engine

risk_factors.description: Risk factors are conditions or variables that increase the likelihood of fraud or financial irregularities, assessed by our risk management system to determine the threat level of a transaction

three_dsecure_outcome.description: The outcome of a 3D Secure authentication process, which verifies the identity of a cardholder during an online purchase. Can be one of: `ATTEMPTED`, `AUTHENTICATED`, `FAILED`, `NOT_APPLICABLE`, `NOT_REQUESTED`. Learn more about [3D Secure](/docs/issuing__3d-secure-authentication)

wallet_provider_account_score.description: Indicates the wallet providers confidence in the account between 1 to 5, where 5 indicates the most confidence in the account

wallet_provider_device_score.description: Indicates the wallet providers confidence in the device between 1 to 5, where 5 indicates the most confidence in the device

payment_method.description: Payment method. Can be one of `APPLE_WALLET`, `GOOGLE_PAY`, `CARD_ON_FILE`

amount.description: Transaction limit amount. This field is mandatory and must be greater than 0. Customer can set perTransaction limit up to a maximum amount (The maximum amount is part of account setting)

interval.description: Transaction limit interval. This field is mandatory and must be one of: `PER_TRANSACTION`, `DAILY`, `WEEKLY`, `MONTHLY`, `ALL_TIME`

currency.description: Currency code of the card spending limit setting

default.description: Default card spending limit amount of no limit set when create/update card

maximum.description: Maximum spending limit user can set for the card. When create/update card, if spending limit exceed this amount, the create/update card request will be rejected

per_transaction_limits.description: PerTransaction Limit settings for all supported base currency

card_nickname.description: The nickname of the card used

client_data.description: Client data stored against the card record

failure_reason.description: The reason why this transaction failed (if status is FAILED). Can be one of: `ACCOUNT_INVALID`, `CARD_CLOSED`, `CARD_INACTIVE`, `CARD_INVALID`, `CARD_LOST_STOLEN`, `CARD_NOT_ACTIVATED`, `CARDHOLDER_VERIFICATION_FAILED`, `CURRENCY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `CVV_INVALID`, `EXPIRY_MISSING`, `INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS`, `INTERNAL_ERROR`, `INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE`, `LIMIT_EXCEEDED`, `MERCHANT_CATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `NOT_SUPPORTED`, `PIN_INVALID`, `PIN_RETRIES_EXCEEDED`, `REMOTE_AUTH_DECLINED`, `RESTRICTED_COUNTRY`, `SUSPECTED_FRAUD`, `TRANSACTION_BLOCKED`, `TRANSACTION_BLOCKED_AT_TERMINAL`, `CARD_REISSUED_TO_NEW_NUMBER`, `TRANSACTION_USAGE_DISABLED`, `MERCHANT_COUNTRY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_CATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`, `MERCHANT_BRAND_SUBCATEGORY_NOT_ALLOWED`. Learn more about [transaction failure reasons](/docs/issuing__transaction-failure-reasons).

fee_details.description: List of fee details associated with the transaction

lifecycle_id.description: A identifier that links multiple related transactions belonging to the same card payment—such as authorizations, reversals, captures, and refunds—under a single transaction lifecycle. Note: this field will be null for transactions created before January 2025

matched_authorizations.description: List of authorization ids for matching captures and reversals to their corresponding authorization. This is only available for authorizations made after 1st May 2022.

network_transaction_id.description: The transaction ID from VISA network

retrieval_ref.description: Transaction retrieval reference number. Data element 37 of an financial transaction message (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8583)

risk_details.description: Risk details provides a comprehensive overview of the risk evaluation for a card transaction, including identified risk factors, actions taken by the risk engine, and the outcome of the 3D Secure authentication process. It encapsulates key elements that assess the potential threat level, safeguard the transaction, and ensure the cardholder’s identity is verified. N.b. this information will only be available for transactions on or after 1st Sept 2024.

status.description: The status of this transaction. Can be one of: `APPROVED`, `CLEARED`, `EXPIRED`, `FAILED`, `PENDING`, `REVERSED`

transaction_id.description: An unique id for this authorization, a uuid

amount.description: Dispute amount.

created_at.description: Time when the dispute was created.

detailed_status.description: The detailed status of the dispute life cycle between Airwallex and the card scheme. It can be one of: `DISPUTE_FILED`, `PRE_ARB_RECEIVED`, `PRE_ARB_DECLINED_BY_ISSUER`, `ARBITRATION_RECEIVED`, `CHARGEBACK_DECLINED`, `PRE_ARB_DELIVERED`, `PRE_ARB_DECLINED_BY_ACQUIRER`, `ARB_DELIVERED`, `WON`, `LOST`.

id.description: The unique identifier for this dispute.

notes.description: The latest notes that was added to the dispute.

reason.description: The reason for raising the dispute. It can be one of: `SUSPECTED_FRAUD`, `UNAUTHORIZED_TRANSACTION`, `DUPLICATED_TRANSACTION`, `PAID_BY_OTHER_MEANS`, `GOODS_SERVICE_NOT_AS_DESCRIBED`, `GOODS_DAMAGED`, `GOODS_SERVICE_NOT_RECEIVED`, `REFUND_UNPROCESSED`, `GOODS_SERVICE_CANCELED`, `RECURRING_CANCELED`, `OTHER`. Learn more about the [dispute reasons](https://www.airwallex.com/docs/issuing__handle-transaction-disputes#dispute-reasons).

reference.description: A value added for your internal reference.

status.description: The latest status of the dispute. It can be one of: `DRAFT`, `SUBMITTED`, `REJECTED`, `CANCELED`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `WON`, `LOST`, `EXPIRED`. Learn more about the [dispute statuses](https://www.airwallex.com/docs/issuing__handle-transaction-disputes__dispute-statuses).

transaction_id.description: The unique identifier for the disputed transaction.

updated_at.description: Time when the dispute was last updated.

updated_by.description: The party who updated the dispute. It can be one of: `CUSTOMER`, `AIRWALLEX`.

cash_withdrawal_limits.description:
Cash withdrawal transaction limits are based on interval and amount.

If the daily limit is not set, the default daily limit amount for the selected limit currency will be used. The default daily limit amount is part of the account setting. To change the default daily limit amount, please reach out to your account manager.

Please note that the cash withdrawal transaction limits apply exclusively to cash withdrawals and are imposed to help manage potential liability for the account holder and for Airwallex. The account holder may be liable for any unauthorised spending on the card, so please apply the limits responsibly.

Important: This limit will only appear if you have cash withdrawals enabled. Please speak to your account manager if you would like to enable cash withdrawals.

currency.description: Currency for transaction limits (3-letter ISO-4217 code). Will use USD if not set. Examples of valid base currencies are USD, AUD, GBP, EUR, CNY, HKD, SGD, NZD, JPY, CAD, CHF. More currencies may be available for your account: you may query the full list by calling the [Get issuing config](/docs/api#/Issuing/Config/_api_v1_issuing_config/get) endpoint.

limits.description:
Transaction limits are based on interval and amount.

If the per transaction limit is not set, the default per transaction limit amount for the selected limit currency will be used. The default per transaction amount is part of account settings. To change the default per transaction limit, please reach out to your account manager.

The account holder may be liable for any unauthorised spending on the card, so please apply limits responsibly.

If the daily limit is not set, the default daily limit amount for the selected limit currency will be used. The default daily limit amount is part of the account setting. To change the default daily limit amount, please reach out to your account manager.

Please note that the cash withdrawal transaction limits apply exclusively to cash withdrawals and are imposed to help manage potential liability for the account holder and for Airwallex. The account holder may be liable for any unauthorised spending on the card, so please apply the limits responsibly.

Important: This limit will only appear if you have cash withdrawals enabled. Please speak to your account manager if you would like to enable cash withdrawals.

The account holder may be liable for any unauthorised spending on the card, so please apply limits responsibly.

transaction_scope.description: Types of transaction scope. It can be one of: `ALL_TRANSACTIONS`, `ONLINE_TRANSACTION`, `CONTACTLESS_TRANSACTION`, `CONTACT_CHIP_TRANSACTION`, `MAGSTRIPE`, `CASH_WITHDRAWAL`, `BILL_PAYMENT`, `ACCOUNT_FUNDING`

usage_scope.description: Determines if a transaction can be made domestically and/or internationally. It can be one of: `ALL`, `INTERNATIONAL`, `DOMESTIC`

postal_address.description: Optional postal address of the cardholder. Only required if different to address and physical cards are to be issued.

evidence_files.description: A list of file id that contains the evidence for the dispute. The file id can be retrieved after uploading the supporting document via [POST Upload a file](https://www.airwallex.com/docs/api#/Supporting_Services/File_Service/_api_v1_files_upload/post).

reason.description: The reason for raising the dispute. This value can be updated only when dispute status = DRAFT. Once a dispute is submitted, this cannot be updated.

request_id.description: A unique request ID specified by the client. Requests with the same request_id will be ignored. This allows requests to be replayed if the client is unsure of the outcome, e.g. due to network issues, system failures, etc.

 Contact your account manager for settlement timing and configuration options.

client_rate.description: The rate at which the client is being billed for the amendment (inherited from the client’s existing conversion rate configuration).

amount.description: A positive integer specifying the amount of the fee expressed in the smallest unit of the currency. e.g. cents for USD. This field is required only when type is FIXED.

currency.description:
Specify the currency of the application fee in ISO 4217 currency code format, e.g., USD, AUD. This field is required when the type is FIXED.
When the type is PERCENTAGE and source_type is CONVERSION, the currency for the conversion if specified must be from the currency pair. If the currency is unspecified, the contra currency of the quote will be used.

metadata.description: The metadata of the application fee. The value should be set in key:value format. (e.g., id:1).

percentage.description:
Required if the type is PERCENTAGE, and the value to be provided depends on the transaction context.
FX Conversions: The value acts as a markup on the FX rate, increasing the conversion cost by the specified percentage.

source_type.description: Specify type of the source transaction.

type.description: Define the type of fee calculation. If the `source_type` is `CONVERSION`, then the type must be `PERCENTAGE`.

industry_category.description:
The industry category most aligned with the primary business activities based on your company country.
* In CN/HK/SG, should be one of the following categories: 
  * E-Commerce Marketplace - Platform
  * E-Commerce Marketplace - Merchant
  * Goods trade
  * Digital Content & Online Gaming
  * Travel
  * Advertising / Affiliate Marketing
  * Education
  * Logistics
  * Services - Non Financial Related
  * Payment Service Provider
  * Other Financial Related Services
  * Others

* In Other country, should be one of the following categories:
  * Agriculture, forestry and fishing
  * Mining and quarrying

Please navigate to the 'Supporting Services' > 'Reference Data' > 'Industry categories' section for an endpoint to pull a tree of categories. The dynamic schema in our documentation does not support selecting a sub-category, therefore the level 3 category content below will always be 'should be null' in our documentation.

description_of_industry.description: Free text description of industry. Max length is 500 characters.

purpose.description:
The purpose of the account. This value should align with your industry category:
* Advertising / Affiliate Marketing -> `Advertising income collection and payment`, `Advertising associated income collection and payment`, `Payment to freelance partners or suppliers`
* Digital Content & Online Gaming -> `Digital content income collection and payment`, `Online game income and payment`, `Payment to DC suppliers`, `Payment to freelance partners or suppliers`
* E-Commerce Marketplace - Platform -> `E-Commerce income collection and payment`
* E-Commerce Marketplace - Merchant -> `E-Commerce income collection and payment`
* Education -> `Payment to schools or teachers`
* Logistics -> `Logistic supplier payment and settlement`
* Payment Service Provider -> `Merchant settlement`, `FX conversion`, `Supply chain financing and repayment`, `P2P remittance`
* Travel -> `OTA payment to freelance partners or suppliers`
* Goods trade -> `Goods trade income collection and payment`
* Other Financial Related Services -> `Supply chain financing and repayment`, `P2P remittance`
* Services - Non Financial Related -> `International consulting fee payment`
* Others -> Please Specify, max length is 100 characters

scope.description:
The scopes indicate the resources your application is allowed to access. The value should be expressed as a list. Currently supported scopes:
 * `w:awx_action:onboarding`: used by the embedded onboarding component
 * `w:awx_action:transfers_edit`: used by the embedded payout component and the embedded beneficiary component
 * `w:awx_action:kyb`: used by the embedded KYB component
 * `r:awx_action:rfi_view`: used by the embedded RFI component to view open RFIs
 * `w:awx_action:rfi_edit`: used by the embedded RFI component to edit and submit responses to RFIs
 * `r:awx_action:sca_view`: used by the embedded SCA component to get the context of SCA
 * `w:awx_action:sca_edit`: used by the embedded SCA component to set up or change the authentication factors of SCA
 * `r:awx_action:tax_form_view`: used by the embedded tax form component to get details of tax forms.
 * `w:awx_action:tax_form_edit`: used by the embedded tax form component to create or edit tax forms

provider_failure_details.description: A set of original information received from the local clearing system.

code.description:
The type of error.  This determines the relevance of other error data fields.

| Error code | Description |
| --- | --- |
| MISSING_REQUIRED_VALUE | The field is required but was not supplied |
| FAILED_VALIDATION_FUNCTIONS | The supplied value failed one or more validation rules.  Refer to `validation_functions`. |
| INVALID_TYPE | The supplied value is not the correct data type.  Refer to `expected_type`. |
| IRRELEVANT_VALUE | An irrelevant field was supplied, e.g. company name for personal beneficiary. |
| MISSING_DECISION_VALUE | The value of this field could not be implied from other supplied fields. |
| SCHEMA_UNKNOWN | The schema for this field could not be determined.  Refer to `schema_unknown_reason`. |
| INTERNAL_ERROR | An unexpected internal problem has occurred.  Please advise support if persists. |

description.description:
A display-friendly description of the error code.

E.g. "This field is required"

error_details.description: A list of error detail, supporting validation revamp response standard

expected_type.description:
The data type that should have been supplied.

Relevant for error codes: `INVALID_TYPE`.

schema_depends_on.description:
The field whose value is required to determine this field's schema.

Relevant for schema unknown reasons: `DEPENDENCY_NOT_PROVIDED`, `DEPENDENCY_INVALID`.

*[test-only]*: This field is for integration debugging purposes only and should not be used in production flows.  It may be removed in future as a backwards-compatible change.

schema_unknown_reason.description:
When schema rules are unknown, provides the reason why.

| Code | Description |
| --- | --- |
| DEPENDENCY_NOT_PROVIDED | This field's rules could not be determined, as they depend on another field which was not supplied.  Refer to `schema_depends_on` for the other field's path. |
| DEPENDENCY_INVALID | This field's rules could not be determined, as they depend on another field whose value is invalid.  Refer to `schema_depends_on` for the other field's path, and check for a validation error reported against it. |
| INTERNAL_ERROR | An unexpected internal problem has occurred whilst trying to determine the schema for this field.  Please advise support if persists. |

Relevant for error codes: `SCHEMA_UNKNOWN`.

*[test-only]*: This field is for integration debugging purposes only and should not be used in production flows.  It may be removed in future as a backwards-compatible change.

validation_functions.description:
A list of the validation functions which failed, including display-friendly descriptions and structured data for custom translation.

Relevant for error codes: `FAILED_VALIDATION_FUNCTIONS`.

value.description:
The supplied value.

Relevant for error codes: `INVALID_TYPE`, `IRRELEVANT_VALUE`, `SCHEMA_UNKNOWN`, `FAILED_VALIDATION_FUNCTIONS`.

url.description:
This URL is used for liveness verification, necessary in certain cases. Ensure recipients open it on their mobile devices, equipped with a valid ID or passport and a working camera.

Please note:
  • If `LIVENESS` is the only question in the RFI, the `Respond to an RFI` API does not need a separate call. It will be auto-resolved after verification.
  • For RFIs with both `LIVENESS` and other questions, please complete liveness verification before responding to the rest.

type.description:
The type of the reserve plan. Possible values:

  • `DELAYED`: All funds will settle to your wallet `delayed.delay_in_days` days after transaction.
  • `ROLLING`: `rolling.rolling_percentage` percent of funds will be held for `rolling.rolling_window_in_days` days, while the rest will settle in 2-3 days after transaction.
  • `DELAYED_ROLLING`: Combination of `DELAYED` and `ROLLING` reserve plans. All funds will be held for `delayed_rolling.delay_in_days` days and `delayed_rolling.rolling_percentage` percent of funds will be held for additional `delayed_rolling.rolling_window_in_days` after transaction.

type.description: The type of response to the question

The type of the source. Type of values and their corresponding API:

  • `PERSON`: Get account by ID
    • `BUSINESS`: match `account_details.business_person_details.person_id` with the source id
    • `INDIVIDUAL`: match `account_details.individual_details.person_id` with the source id
    • If there is no matched person on your account, this indicates that Airwallex has introduced a new individual during the review process. Once verification is complete, this person will be added to your account.
  • `CARDHOLDER`: Get cardholder details
  • `PAYMENT_INTENT`: Retrieve a PaymentIntent
For `TRANSACTION` RFI:
  • `CHARGE`: Get a charge by ID
  • `TRANSFER`: Get a transfer by ID
  • `DIRECT_DEBIT`: Get direct debit by ID
  • `DEPOSIT`: Get a deposit by ID
  • `PAYMENT`: Get payment by ID

depends_on.description:
When dependency error, indicates the field whose value is required to determine this field's schema.

Applicable for schema unknown reasons: `DEPENDENCY_NOT_PROVIDED`, `DEPENDENCY_INVALID`.

*[test-only]*: This field is for integration debugging purposes only and should not be used in production flows.  It may be removed in future as a backwards-compatible change.

relevant.description:
When schema known, indicates whether the field is relevant in this scenario.  This can be used to determine whether to display the field in the user interface.

Applicable when `rules_known` is true.

required.description:
When relevant, indicates whether the field is mandatory (true) or optional (false).

Applicable when `relevant` is true.

rules_known.description: Indicates whether the schema could be determined for this field.  If false, refer to `schema_unknown_reason`.

schema_input_only.description:
When relevant, indicates that this field is only used for specifying options during schema retrieval.  These options are generally implied during creation requests.

E.g. `locked_amount` is a decision field that specifies whether to use source amount or payment amount.

Applicable when `relevant` is true.

schema_unknown_reason.description:
When schema rules are unknown, provides the reason why.

| Code | Description |
| --- | --- |
| DEPENDENCY_NOT_PROVIDED | This field's rules could not be determined, as they depend on another field which was not supplied.  Refer to `schema_depends_on` for the other field's path. |
| DEPENDENCY_INVALID | This field's rules could not be determined, as they depend on another field whose value is invalid.  Refer to `schema_depends_on` for the other field's path, and check for a validation error reported against it. |
| INTERNAL_ERROR | An unexpected internal problem has occurred whilst trying to determine the schema for this field.  Please advise support if persists. |

Applicable when `rules_known` is false.

*[test-only]*: This field is for integration debugging purposes only and should not be used in production flows.  It may be removed in future as a backwards-compatible change.

type.description:
When relevant, indicates the data type of the field.

Applicable when `rules_known` is true.

validation_functions.description:
When relevant, provides the rules this field must pass to be valid.

These include both textual descriptions and data, allowing for displaying rules/errors, client side validation, dropdown values, client side masking, etc.

Applicable when `relevant` is true.

errors.description: If the provided request is invalid, provides a map from field path to field validation failure details.  Similar to the validation endpoint's response.  May be used to both validate existing user form input and retrieve other fields in a single call.

schema.description: The schema for the given request, as a map from field path to field schema.

refresh.description: Whether updating this field triggers UI reload event

service_agreement_type.description:
The user’s service type of their agreement. Default to FULL.
A [FULL service agreement](https://www.airwallex.com/terms/scale-user-terms-global) creates a service relationship between Airwallex and the account holder.
A [RECIPIENT service agreement](https://www.airwallex.com/terms/recipient-agreement-global) clarifies that there is no service relationship between Airwallex and the recipient, and that the recipient’s relationship is with the platform. This service agreement type is required for creating [Ledger Account](https://www.airwallex.com/docs/payments-for-platforms__payments-for-marketplaces).

  • `provisional`: The account is subject to provisional transfer limits, full verification is required to remove them.
  • `standard`: The account is fully verified with no provisional transfer limits.

amount_beneficiary_receives.description: The total amount (in payment `payment_currency`) the beneficiary receives for this payment, and is governed by value specified in `fee_paid_by`, i.e. if `fee_paid_by` is `PAYER`, then the beneficiary receives the exact same `payment_amount` since payer is responsible for the payment fee.  Otherwise, beneficiary receives `payment_amount - fee` as the fee is implicitly passed onto the beneficiary

amount_payer_pays.description: The total amount (in `source_currency`) the payer has to pay for making this payment. For example, if `fee_paid_by` is `PAYER` and FX conversion is not involved, then this is the sum of `payment_amount + fee` as the payer is responsible for the fee.  Otherwise this field is the same as `payment_amount`

Please navigate to the 'Supporting Services' > 'Reference Data' > 'Industry categories' section for an endpoint to pull a tree of categories. The dynamic schema in our documentation does not support selecting a sub-category, therefore the level 3 category content below will always be 'should be null' in our documentation.

name.description:
The validation function identifier.

This can be mapped to a custom error translation or client side validation function.

parameters.description:
Parameters of the validation rule, as an object.
These can be used to retrieve details of the relevant validation rule, as structured data.
This can be used for custom rule/error translations, client-side validation, client-side masking, populating dropdowns, etc.
Please review the parameterized descriptions below to see which parameters are returned for each type of validation function.
E.g. `{ min: 5, max: 10 }`


Validation functions which can be used for client-side validation (simple logic, no server-side dependencies):

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| AccountCurrencyMatchesPaymentCurrency | The bank account currency must match the payment currency |
| Alphanumeric | Should contain alphanumeric characters only |
| AlphanumericIncludingPunctuation | Should contain alphanumeric characters or punctuation only |
| AlphanumericIncludingSpaces | Should contain alphanumeric characters or spaces only |
| Boolean | Should be either true or false |
| BPayAlphanumeric | Should only contain valid characters for Customer reference number |
| ChineseCharacters | Should contain Chinese characters only |
| ChineseCharactersIncludingPunctuation | Should contain Chinese characters or punctuation only |
| CNAccountNameMatchesFirstLastNameInChinese | The account name should match the first and last names in Chinese |
| RecipientIsAccountUBO | The beneficiary to add must belongs to one of the UBOs for the given MyBank account |
| MyBankDateSharingIsEnabled | Data sharing must be enabled for the given MyBank account |
| MyBankPaymentCollectionIsEnabled | Payment collection must be activated for the given MyBank account |
| Date | Should be a valid date, formatted in ISO8601 date format |
| DateTime | Should be a valid date and time, formatted in ISO8601 datetime format |
| DigitsOnly | Should contain digits only |
| Email | Should be a valid email address |
| Equal | Should equal {value} |
| IbanCountryOneOf | The country code in the IBAN should match the bank country code |
| Length | Should be {length} characters long |
| MaxLength | Should contain at most {max} characters |
| MinItems | Should contain at least {min} item(s) |
| MinLength | Should contain at least {min} characters |
| MinMaxLength | Should contain {min} to {max} characters |
| NumberOfDecimalPlaces | Should have at most {decimalPlaces} decimal places |
| OneOf | Should be one of the following: [{values}] |
| PaymentAmountOrSourceAmountIsSpecified | Either payment_amount or source_amount must be specified |
| PositiveNumber | Should be a positive number |
| PositivePrice | Should be positive, max. 2 decimal places |
| SwiftCodeMatchesCountry | The SWIFT code should match the bank country code selected |


Validation functions which should only be used for error/rule translation (complex logic or server-side dependencies):

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| AccountRoutingValue1IsReal | Should be valid and supported |
| BeneficiaryContactExists | Should be an existing beneficiary for this account |
| BeneficiaryContactIsValid | Should pass beneficiary validation |
| BeneficiaryContactStreetAddressIsValid | Should provide street address |
| BeneficiaryContactSupportsPaymentMethod | The specified beneficiary should support the specified payment method |
| BillerIdIsReal | Should be valid and supported |
| CNAreaCodeIsReal | Should be valid and supported |
| CNBankCodeIsReal | Should be valid and supported |
| GteToday | Should be today or a future date |
| IbanIsValid | Should be valid and supported |
| MayNotSpecifyPayer | payer or payer_id may not be provided |
| MaxAmount | Should be at maximum {currency} {max} in value |
| MinAmount | Should be at minimum {currency} {min} in value |
| MinMaxAge | Should be between {min} and {max} years old |
| PayerContactExists | Should be an existing payer for this account |
| PayerContactIsValid | Should pass payer validation |
| PaymentChannelNotSupported | This payment channel is not currently supported |
| PaymentOrderInfo_ItemTotalCorrect | The line total of each item specified must match the unit price multiplied by the quantity |
| PaymentOrderInfo_OrdersAllSameCurrency | All orders in this payment must be of the same currency |
| PaymentOrderInfo_TotalEqualsPaymentAmount | The total amount of all orders for the payment must match the payment amount |
| PaymentOrderInfo_TotalEqualsSourceAmount | The total amount of all orders for the payment must match the source amount |
| SwiftCodeIsReal | Should be a valid and supported SWIFT code / BIC |
| SwiftCodeIsSupported | Should be valid and supported |
| WhitespaceTrimmed | Should not contain leading or trailing whitespace characters |

server_side_only.description: Whether this validation function is unsuitable for mapping to a client-side validation function.  Generally this indicates a dependence on server-side resources or complex logic.

identity_verification.description: Details for identity verification cases. Null for other types of cases

type.description: Verification case type. One of 'IDENTITY_VERIFICATION'

code.description:
The high-level outcome of account verification. Could be one of the following:
- `VERIFIED`: This is a valid account (name match is not guaranteed).
- `INVALID`: This account does not exist.
- `CANNOT_VERIFY`: We cannot verify this account due to external restrictions.
- `EXTERNAL_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE`: The request failed due to unavailability of external services. Trying again later.

details.description: Detailed verification results including name match results if available

message.example: This is a valid account. Refer to the details object for verification details.
message.description: A descriptional message of the verification result

local_clearing_system.description:
Which clearing system should be used for this local bank transfer.

Please refer to our [payout guide](https://airwallex.com/guides/payout) for details about each option.

We suggest explicitly specifying this value, however if it's not provided we will select a default (using the specified account routing type and/or what's most often the best option).

amount_beneficiary_receives.description: The total amount (in payment `payment_currency`) the beneficiary receives for this payment, and is governed by value specified in `fee_paid_by`, i.e. if `fee_paid_by` is `PAYER`, then the beneficiary receives the exact same `payment_amount` since payer is responsible for the payment fee.  Otherwise, beneficiary receives `payment_amount - fee` as the fee is implicitly passed onto the beneficiary

amount_payer_pays.description: The total amount (in `source_currency`) the payer has to pay for making this payment. For example, if `fee_paid_by` is `PAYER` and FX conversion is not involved, then this is the sum of `payment_amount + fee` as the payer is responsible for the fee.  Otherwise this field is the same as `payment_amount`

A unique request ID specified by the client.  Payout creation requests with a `request_id` that has been used in the past 7 days are treated as duplicated payout and cannot be processed. When you are not sure about the outcome of a payout creation request, e.g. when there are network issues or system failures such as timeout, you can try to get a payout with this `request_id` to find out.

- `CUSTOMER_RELATIONSHIP_MAINTENANCE` 
- `LOW_VALUE_TRANSACTION`
- `VALID_CUSTOMER_DISPUTE` 
- `NO_ACTION_TAKEN_BY_MERCHANT`
- `RDR_AUTO_ACCEPTED` 
- `COLLABORATION_ACCEPTED_MANUAL`
- `COLLABORATION_AUTO_ACCEPTED`
- `COLLABORATION_AUTO_ACCEPTED_BY_EXPIRY`
- `OTHERS`

- `VALID_CUSTOMER_DISPUTE`

recipient.description: Details of the recipient for this account funding transaction.

sender.description: Details of the sender for this account funding transaction.

transfer_between_own_accounts.description: Indicates whether the transfer is between the customer's own accounts. If true, Airwallex will compare the cardholder's name and the recipient's name, and will trigger 3DS if the names do not match.

type.description:
Account funding transaction type. Possible values: 

**ACCOUNT_TO_ACCOUNT_TRANSFER**
- An account-to-account transfer, either within the same financial institution or to a different one.
**STORED_VALUE_DIGITAL_WALLET_TRANSFER**
- Adding funds to or cashing out a Stored Value Digital Wallet (SVDW) account.
**STAGED_DIGITAL_WALLET_TRANSFER**
- Funding a Staged Digital Wallet before the cardholder makes a purchase.
**PREPAID_CARD_TOP_UP**
- Prepaid card or gift card top-up (adding value to an eligible reloadable prepaid card or funding the cardholder’s own prepaid account).
**LIQUID_ASSET_PURCHASE**
- Funds transfer for the acquisition of liquid assets (for example, stocks, shares, foreign currency and cryptocurrency).

passkey_setup_status.description:
Status of payment passkey setup for the card/device used in the transaction, during cardholder authentication. Possible values: SETUP_COMPLETED, ALREADY_SETUP, FAILED_TO_SETUP, NOT_TRIGGERED
- SETUP_COMPLETED: Payment passkey was successfully set up.
- ALREADY_SETUP: Payment passkey was already set up for this card/device combination in a previous transaction.
- FAILED_TO_SETUP: Attempted to set up a payment passkey, but the setup failed.
- NOT_TRIGGERED: Payment passkey setup was not supported or not applicable for this transaction (transaction was not processed via the passkey flow).

You must also set `auto_capture` to be `false` if you want to do pre-auth.

card_sequence_number.description: A unique identifier to distinguish among separate cards having the same PAN. For chip transactions, it is the tag 5F34 of the emv data.

cardholder_verification_method.description:
Cardholder verification method.
- `offline_pin`: The PIN is verified offline by the EMV chip card.
- `online_pin`: The PIN is encrypted and verified online by issuers or card schemes. `encrypted_pin` is required for `online_pin`.
- `manual_signature`: The cardholder signature on the receipt is compared to the signature on the back of the card.
- `no_cvm`: No verification needed.
- `cdcvm`: Cardholder device verification method. The cardholder is verified using a device's authentication method.
- `offline_pin_and_signature`: Both an offline PIN and a manual signature are used to verify the cardholder.
- `skipped`: Verification process was bypassed.

emv_tags.description:
Tag-length-value (TLV)-encoded data read from a chip card. Required when pan_entry_mode is chip, contactless_chip.

Mandatory tags:
- 82 - Application interchange profile
- 84 - Dedicated file name
- 95 - Terminal verification results
- 9A - Application date
- 9C - Transaction type
- 5F2A - Transaction currency code
- 9F02 - Amount authorized
- 9F10 - Issuer application data
- 9F1A - Terminal country code
- 9F26 - Application cryptogram
- 9F27 - Cryptogram information
- 9F34 - Cardholder verification method results
- 9F36 - Application transaction counter
- 9F37 - Unpredictable number

Recommended tags:
- 9F33 - Terminal capabilities
- 9F35 - Terminal type
- 9F41 - Transaction sequence counter

Provide if present:
- 5F34 - Card sequence number

encrypted_pin.description: Encrypted personal identification number. Required when `cardholder_verification_method` is `online_pin`.

expiry_month.description: Two digit number representing the card’s expiration month. Required when `pan_entry_mode` is `manual_entry`.

expiry_year.description: Four digit number representing the card’s expiration year. Required when `pan_entry_mode` is `manual_entry`.

fallback.description:
The default is `false`. Set to `true` when:
- Chip card at a chip-capable terminal was unable to process transactions using data on the chip or magnetic strip and use entry mode `manual`.
- Chip card at a chip-capable terminal was unable to process transactions using data on the chip and use entry mode `contact_magnetic_stripe_card`.

fallback_reason.description:
Fallback reason applicable when `fallback` is `true`.
Set to `chip_read_failure` when all of the following conditions are met:
- The transaction is initiated at a chip-capable terminal.
- `pan_entry_mode` is `magstripe`.
- The previous transaction initiated by the terminal was an unsuccessful chip read.

key_serial_number.description: Key serial number while using DUKPT for PIN encryption.

pan_entry_mode.description:
The way the terminal reads the card information.
- `manual_entry`: Manually keyed into POS terminal.
- `chip`: Read from direct contact with a chip card.
- `magstripe`: Read from direct contact with magnetic stripe card.
- `contactless_chip`: Read from a contactless interface using chip data.
- `contactless_magstripe`: Read from a contactless interface using magnetic stripe data (MSD).

terminal_info.description: Data obtained by the POS terminal from the card and terminal properties.

track1.description: Track 1 read from magnetic stripe card

track2.description:
Track 2 is read from a magnetic stripe card or is track 2 equivalent data get from the chip card.
Track 2 is required when `pan_entry_mode` is not `manual_entry`.

reason.description:
The reason why the merchant challenges the dispute. Possible values: 

**CUSTOMER_WITHDRAWN**
- The customer withdrew the dispute
**CUSTOMER_REFUNDED**
- The customer has already been refunded
**PRODUCT_RECEIVED**
- The customer has already received / will receive the product or service
**PURCHASE_HISTORY**
- The customer has a purchasing history with me
**NOT_ENTITLED**
- The customer is not entitled to refund
**SEPARATE_PRODUCT**
- The customer purchased separate products or services
**AUTHENTIC_PRODUCT**
- The product is not damaged, defective or counterfeit
**OTHER_REASONS**
- Other reasons for challenging

type.description:
Type of the documents. Possible values: `PRIMARY`, `ORDER`, `CUSTOMER`, `OTHER`.

**PRIMARY**
- The primary evidence depends on the challenge reason.
**ORDER**
- Order related evidence.
**CUSTOMER**
- Customer related evidence.
**OTHER**
- Other supporting evidence.

shopper_name.description: The name of the shopper. Must be between 3 and 100 characters in length.

cavv.description: Cardholder Authentication Verification Value. Base64-encoded 28-character string.

eci.description:
Electronic Commerce Indicator. As defined by 3D-Secure.
- `00`: **Mastercard variant**: Authentication failed.
- `01`: **Mastercard variant**: Authentication attempted.
- `02`: **Mastercard variant**: Authentication succeeded.
- `04`: **Mastercard variant**: Frictionless authentication via data only mode.
- `05`: Authentication succeeded.
- `06`: Authentication attempted. **Mastercard variant**: Exempted from Strong Customer Authentication.
- `07`: Authentication failed or exempted. **Mastercard variant**: Recurring transaction successfully authenticated.

initial_payment.description:
Set this to `true` if it is the initial transaction request in a recurring series.

Default: `false`.

merchant_trigger_reason.description:
Indicate if this subsequent payment is scheduled. Only applicable when `triggered_by` is `merchant`. One of `scheduled`, `unscheduled`, `installments`.

Default: `scheduled`

original_transaction_id.description:
The original transaction reference which can be provided to increase the odds of getting approved by issuer when `triggered_by` is `merchant` (not in customer's presence).
Do not pass this value when `initial_payment` is `true` or if you are not clear about the valid formats (as listed below).
- Visa (`card`) - 15 digits unique ID Visa assigns to the response of the original authorization request, i.e. `123456789012345`
- Mastercard (`card`) - 13 characters trace id (DE 63 Subfield 1 & 2 + DE 15) from the response of the original authorization request, i.e. `MCC123ABC0101`

status.description:
**RECEIVED**
- The PaymentAttempt has been created upon request.
**AUTHENTICATION_REDIRECTED**
- The PaymentAttempt is waiting for further customer action of authentication, e.g. 3DS verification and QR code scan.
**PENDING_AUTHORIZATION**
- The PaymentAttempt authorization request has been accepted and is pending the final result from the provider.
**AUTHORIZED**
- The PaymentAttempt was successfully authorized. It will either be automatically captured or require a manual capture to finalize the payment. Please be aware that capturing the payment is not possible if the PaymentIntent status is **PENDING_REVIEW**.
**CAPTURE_REQUESTED**
- The PaymentAttempt has been successfully requested for capture. The payment is complete.
**EXPIRED**
- The PaymentAttempt expired after the allowed payment time. Please create a new PaymentAttempt to retry.
**CANCELLED**
- The PaymentAttempt has been cancelled. The previously authorized amount (if any) will be returned to the customer.
**FAILED**
- The PaymentAttempt has failed. Please create a new PaymentAttempt to retry.
**SETTLED**
- Airwallex has received the settlement from the provider. We will settle the funds in your wallet.
**PAID**
- Airwallex has settled the funds in your wallet.

status.description:
**PENDING_VERIFICATION**
- Ready for verification or in the process of verification if `next_action` is returned to guide the next step.
**PENDING**
- The mandate of the PaymentConsent has been submitted. It only occurs when payment method type is `bacs_direct_debit`. You need to wait for the final result. The status will become `DISABLED` if the mandate is rejected or `VERIFIED` if the mandate is accepted.
**VERIFIED**
- The PaymentConsent has been verified and it can be used for subsequent payments.
**DISABLED**
- The PaymentConsent is disabled. You cannot verify it again.

status.description:
PaymentDispute status. Possible values: 

**REQUIRES_RESPONSE**
- In this status, you can decide whether to accept or challenge the PaymentDispute.
- Applicable when receive notification from card schemes that PaymentDispute has entered `RFI`, `PRE_CHARGEBACK`, `CHARGEBACK`, or `PRE_ARBITRATION` stage.
**CHALLENGED**
- In this status, we have informed the issuing bank that you would like to challenge the PaymentDispute.
- Applicable when you challenge the PaymentDispute. At `PRE_CHARGEBACK` stage, the issuing bank will escalate to the chargeback stage in the following days. At `RFI`, `CHARGEBACK`, and `PRE_ARBITRATION` stage, the issuing bank will review your submitted evidence and decide whether to escalate the PaymentDispute or not.
**ACCEPTED**
- In this status the PaymentDispute has been accepted and the payment will be refunded to the shopper.
- Applicable when you accept the PaymentDispute at `RFI`, `PRE_CHARGEBACK`, `CHARGEBACK`, and `PRE_ARBITRATION` stage.
**REVERSED**
- In this status, the PaymentDispute has been reversed by the issuing bank. No further action is required.
- Applicable when receive notification from card schemes that PaymentDispute has been reversed at `PRE_CHARGEBACK`, `CHARGEBACK`, and `PRE_ARBITRATION` stage.
**WON**
- In this status, the issuing bank has accepted the response provided, or card schemes have ruled the PaymentDispute decision in your favor. No further action is required.
- Applicable at `CHARGEBACK`, `PRE_ARBITRATION` and `ARBITRATION` stage.
**LOST**
- In this status, the issuing bank has not accepted the evidence provided by you, or card schemes have ruled the PaymentDispute decision in Issuer’s favor. No further action is required.
- Applicable at `PRE_ARBITRATION` and `ARBITRATION` stage.
**PENDING_CLOSURE**
- In this status, the issuing bank has escalated the PaymentDispute to `PRE_ARBITRATION` stage and Airwallex is reviewing the PaymentDispute. Airwallex will decide whether to accept the PaymentDispute or respond to it on your behalf and may reach out to you for more information.
- Applicable at `PRE_ARBITRATION` stage.
**EXPIRED**
- In this status, the `RFI` event has expired as you have not responded to the request within 15 days.
- Applicable at `RFI` stage.
**PENDING_DECISION**
- In this status, we have responded to the issuing bank with evidence provided by you. The issuing bank will review your submitted evidence and decide whether to accept the PaymentDispute or not.
- Applicable at `PRE_ARBITRATION` and `ARBITRATION` stage.

status.description:
Please note that this list of statuses is not exhaustive, you should be prepared to handle intent statuses beyond those explicitly mentioned.
**REQUIRES_PAYMENT_METHOD**
- The PaymentIntent is waiting for the [confirm](#/Payment_Acceptance/Payment_Intents/_api_v1_pa_payment_intents__id__confirm/post) request.
- This status is returned right after the PaymentIntent is created or the previous PaymentAttempt has failed or expired.
**REQUIRES_CUSTOMER_ACTION**
- The PaymentIntent is waiting for further customer action of authentication, e.g. 3DS verification and QR code scan. Please check the `next_action`.
**PENDING_REVIEW**
- The PaymentIntent was successfully authorized, but it is currently under review for risk compliance.
**REQUIRES_CAPTURE**
- The PaymentIntent is waiting for your [capture](api#/Payment_Acceptance/Payment_Intents/_api_v1_pa_payment_intents__id__capture/post) to complete the payment.
**PENDING**
- The PaymentIntent is pending the final result from the provider. No further action is required.
**SUCCEEDED**
- The PaymentIntent has succeeded. The payment is complete.
**CANCELLED**
- The PaymentIntent has been canceled by your [request](api#/Payment_Acceptance/Payment_Intents/_api_v1_pa_payment_intents__id__cancel/post). The payment is closed.

- The PaymentIntent was successfully authorized, but it is currently under review for risk compliance.
**REQUIRES_CAPTURE**
- The PaymentIntent is waiting for your [capture](api#/Payment_Acceptance/Payment_Intents/_api_v1_pa_payment_intents__id__capture/post) to complete the payment.
**PENDING**
- The PaymentIntent is pending the final result from the provider. No further action is required.
**SUCCEEDED**
- The PaymentIntent has succeeded. The payment is complete.
**CANCELLED**
- The PaymentIntent has been canceled by your [request](api#/Payment_Acceptance/Payment_Intents/_api_v1_pa_payment_intents__id__cancel/post). The payment is closed.

triggered_by.description:
Indicates who initiated the payment — the `merchant` or the `customer`.
- `merchant`: The payment is initiated by the merchant to collect a subsequent payment where the customer is not in session.
- `customer`: The payment is initiated by the customer using stored payment method details.

Leave this field empty if the customer is unknown (guest checkout) or if the customer details are provided via the customer object. If only `additional_info` is provided in the customer object for the Payment Intent, you can still include `customer_id` in the request.
