dispute_status.description: The latest status of the dispute. For more information on dispute statuses, refer to https://www.airwallex.com/docs/payments__disputes__handle-disputes-on-the-airwallex-web-app

exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate used for converting the transaction amount into the settlement amount

fees.description: Amount of the total fees paid for the transaction in the settlement currency, exclusive of taxes

gross_amount.description: Amount of the transaction, converted into the settlement currency

issuing_or_originating_bank.description: Name of financial institution that the shopper's payment method was issued from, if applicable

merchant_customer_id.description: Unique identifier of the customer provided by you, if applicable. Maximum length is 64.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to the Settlement Record. You can specify up to 50 keys with key names up to 50 characters long and values up to 500 characters long.

net_amount.description: Net amount of the transaction in the settlement currency, after subtracting the fees

order_id.description: Unique identifier from your order system associated with a payment intent

payment_attempt_ids.description: Unique identifiers for payment attempt associated with this payment

payment_created_time.description: Time at which the payment intent was created

payment_intent_id.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent

payment_link_reference.description: Reference for the payment link input by your customer, if applicable

payment_method.description: The payment method used by the shopper for this transaction

payment_method_type.description: Helps you identify the payment method, if applicable, for example: Card brand when ApplePay or GooglePay are used: Visa, Mastercard, etc. Klarna: Pay Now, Pay Later, etc.

request_id.description: Unique identifier from your system associated to your request to Airwallex

settled_at.description: Timestamp of when the financial transaction was settled into your wallet

settlement_batch_id.description: Unique identifier associated with the batch settlement

settlement_currency.description: Three-letter ISO code for the settlement currency of the transaction

shipping_address.description: First line of the shipping address associated with this transaction, if applicable

shipping_city.description: City of the shipping address associated with this transaction, if applicable

shipping_country.description: Country of the shipping address associated with this transaction, if applicable

shipping_name.description: Name on the shipping address associated with this transaction, if applicable

shipping_postal_code.description: Postal code of the shipping address associated with this transaction, if applicable

shipping_state.description: State of the shipping address associated with this transaction, if applicable

source_entity.description: Source object associated with the transaction

source_id.description: Unique identifier for the payment attempt, payment consent, refund, or dispute

subscription_id.description: Unique identifier of the subscription related to this transaction, if applicable

taxes_on_fees.description: Amount of the total taxes on fees paid for the transaction in the settlement currency

transaction_currency.description: Three-letter ISO code for the original currency sent to Airwallex for the transaction

transaction_id.description: Unique identifier associated with the financial transaction

transaction_type.description: Categorisation of financial transactions - payment, payment reserve hold, payment reserve release, and refund

first_name.description: First name of the recipient. Maximum of 128 characters.

last_name.description: Last name of the recipient. Maximum of 128 characters.

phone_number.description: Phone number of the recipient. Maximum of 50 characters.

admin_password_status.description:
The terminal admin password status 

**ACTIVE**
- The terminal admin password is active.
**LOCKED**
- The terminal admin password is locked.
**RESET_REQUESTED**
- The terminal admin password requires reset.

connected_account_id.description: Account identifier of the connected account.

model.description: Model of the Terminal, possible values are `morefun_m90`.

refund_password_status.description:
The terminal refund password status 

**ACTIVE**
- The terminal refund password is active.
**LOCKED**
- The terminal refund password is locked.
**RESET_REQUESTED**
- The terminal refund password requires reset.
**OPT_OUT**
- The terminal refund password is opted out.

status.description:
Operational status of the Terminal 

**ACTIVE**
- The Terminal is activated and ready to use.
**INACTIVE**
- The Terminal is deactivated for any reason.
**TERMINATED**
- The Terminal is terminated and can't be used anymore.

request_id.description: Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.

authorization_type.description: The authorization type of the card payment. One of `final_auth`, `pre_auth`. Default to `final_auth`. Set it to `pre_auth` if you want to place a hold on your customer’s card for more than 7 days. Currently only available when the card brand is visa or mastercard. You must also set `auto_capture` to be `false` if you want to do pre-auth.

auto_capture.description: Specifies whether the funds should be requested automatically after the payment is authorized. Default to `true`. Set it to `false` if you want to capture the funds sometimes later.

activation_code.description: The activation code read from the terminal

connected_account_id.description: Airwallex assigned account identifier of the connected entity(another account which is linked with platform). It is to be used by the platform to indicate the connected entity in the transaction where platform is the owner of transaction. Notice: This can not be used with x-on-behalf-of header together.

request_id.description: Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.
Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.

mobile_device.description: Indicate whether the POS terminal is a mobile POS device. Default is `false`.

pin_entry_capability.description:
Describe the capability of the terminal device to accept PIN.
- `unsupported`: Terminal does not have PIN entry capability.
- `supported`: Terminal has PIN entry capability. Except the case suitable for software_based.
- `software_based`: For a mobile POS device, a user can input PIN through software-based keyboard.
- `disabled`: Terminal has PIN entry capability but PIN pad is not currently operative.

support_single_tap_with_pin.description: Indicate whether the POS terminal could respond to a `request_pin` action. Default is `false`.

supported_pan_entry_modes.description: List of `pan_entry_modes` supported by the terminal.

terminal_id.description: An up to 8 digit alphanumeric ID used to identify the terminal at the card acceptor location of the user’s POS system.

use_embedded_reader.description: Indicate whether the reader is embedded in a mobile POS device. Default is `true`.

request_id.description: Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.

password_type.description:
Terminal password type 

**admin**
- The terminal admin password.
**refund**
- The terminal refund password.

request_id.description: Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.
Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.
Unique request ID specified by the merchant. Maximum length is 64.

billing_cycle_charge_day.description: The granularity per billing cycle. Required when payment_schedule.period_unit is WEEK, MONTH, or YEAR. (e.g. charge_day_per_billing_cycle= 5, payment_schedule.period_unit  = MONTH, payment_schedule.period = 1 if collect payment on the 5th of each month).

end_date.description: End date to expect payment request.

first_payment_amount.description: The first payment. It could include the costs associated with the first debited amount.Optional if payment agreement type is `VARIABLE`.

fixed_payment_amount.description: The fixed payment amount that can be charged for a single payment.Required if payment agreement type is `FIXED`.

max_payment_amount.description: The maximum payment amount that can be charged for a single payment.Optional if payment agreement type is `VARIABLE`.

min_payment_amount.description: The minimum payment amount that can be charged for a single payment.Optional if payment agreement type is `VARIABLE`.

payment_amount_type.description:
The agreed type of amounts for subsequent payment. Should be one of `FIXED`, `VARIABLE`.

**FIXED**
- payment amount is fixed. A specific amount is required.
**VARIABLE**
- payment amount is variable at each collection. A max limit is recommended.

payment_currency.description: The currency of this payment. Please refer to [supported currencies](payments__supported-currencies).

start_date.description: Start date to expect payment request.

total_billing_cycles.description: The total number of billing cycles. For example, the mandate will last for 1 year if `total_billing_cycles`=12, `payment_schedule.period`=1 and `payment_schedule.period_unit`=MONTH if the `merchant_trigger_reason` is `scheduled`. Merchant can bill customers 12 times when `total_billing_cycles`=12 if the `merchant_trigger_reason` is `unscheduled`The mandate will continue indefinitely if total_billing_cycles is null.

eci_indicator.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator, as defined by 3-D Secure

online_payment_cryptogram.description: Online payment cryptogram, as defined by 3-D Secure

device_data_collection_res.description: Device data collection response (deprecated in favor of acs_response)

return_url.description: Return URL for 3ds callbacks (in case 3ds is triggered)

bin.description: Bank identify number of this card

brand.description: Brand of the card. One of `visa`, `mastercard`, `maestro`, `chinaunionpay`.

expiry_month.description: Two digit number representing the card’s expiration month

expiry_year.description: Four digit number representing the card’s expiration year

is_commercial.description: A boolean field referring whether the card is commercial or not

issuer_country_code.description: Country code of the card issuer

last4.description: Last four digits of the card number

type.description: The card's type of payment. One of `credit` or `debit`.

expiry_year.description: Four digit number representing the card’s expiration year

carrier.description: The name of the transportation company.

departure_city.description: The city of the departure. Maximum length is 100.

insurances.description: The insurance list for the itinerary.

passenger_title.description: The title used before the traveler’s name. One of `mr`, `ms`, and `mrs`.

price.description: The itinerary unit price in payment intent currency.

scheduled_arrival_at.description: The estimated arrival datetime in ISO 8601 format, including the timezone offset.

scheduled_departure_at.description: The departure datetime in ISO 8601 format, including the timezone offset.

country_code.description: The 2-letter ISO country/region code from which the consumer will be paying. One of `DE`, `DK`, `EE`, `ES`, `FI`, `GB`, `LT`, `LV`, `NL`, `NO`, `PL`, `SE`, `SK`.
The 2-letter ISO country/region code from which the consumer will be paying. One of `DE`, `DK`, `EE`, `ES`, `FI`, `GB`, `LT`, `LV`, `NL`, `NO`, `PL`, `SE`, `SK`.

condition.description: Condition of the vehicle. One of `GOOD`, `FAIR`, `POOR`.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank.

enable_funds_split.description: Indicates whether funds split will be enabled for this WeChatPay order

currency.description: Indicates the currency of subsequent PaymentIntent that will be processed with this PaymentConsent. Please refer to [supported currencies](payments__supported-currencies).

flow.description: The specific WeChat Pay flow to use.  One of `webqr`, `jsapi`, `miniprog`, `inapp`, `mweb`
The specific WechatPay flow to use.  One of `webqr`, `jsapi`, `inapp`, `mweb`
The specific WeChat Pay flow to use.  One of `webqr`, `jsapi`, `miniprog`, `inapp`, `mweb`

shopper_name.description: The name of the shopper. Must be between 3 and 100 characters in length.

skip_risk_processing.description: Set it to `true` if you want to skip fraud processing. Please contact your account manager to enable the feature to take effect. Defaults to `false`.

three_domain_secure_action.description: Deprecated, use three_ds_action - Set it to `FORCE_3DS` if you want to enforce 3ds. `null` by default

three_ds_action.description: Set it to `FORCE_3DS` if you want to enforce 3DS with our 3DS provider. Set it to EXTERNAL_3DS if you want to use your own 3DS provider, in this case `payment_method_options.card.external_three_ds` should be provided in the confirm request. Set it to SKIP_3DS if you want to skip 3DS regardless of the risk score. `null` by default

airline_carrier_code.description: The 2-letter IATA airline carrier code if the itinerary is for airline.

arrival_airport_code.description: The 3-letter IATA airport code, required if the itinerary is for airline.

arrival_city.description: The city of the arrival. Maximum length is 100.

arrive_at.description: The estimated arrival datetime in ISO 8601 format.

depart_at.description: The departure datetime in ISO 8601 format.

departure_airport_code.description: The 3-letter IATA airport code, required if the itinerary is for airline.

departure_city.description: The city of the departure. Maximum length is 100.

insurance.description: The insurance list for the itinerary.

price.description: The itinerary unit price in payment intent currency.

service_class.description: The itinerary service class. One of `first_class`, `business`, `economy`.

traveler_identifier.description: The traveler’s identifier in `order.travelers`. Maximum length is 64.

identifier.description: The identifier of the traveler in the merchant's system. Maximum length is 64.

name.description: The name of the traveler. Maximum length is 100.

title.description: The title used before the traveler’s name. One of `mr`, `ms`, and `mrs`.

id.description: ID of the PaymentConsent referenced for this recurring payment

cvc.description: For initial payment, or subsequent payments when `next_triggered_by` is `customer`, this attribute must be provided in order to confirm successfully
